GRINDR EMPLOYEE, CONTRACTOR, VENDOR AND APPLICANT PRIVACY POLICY

GRINDR EMPLOYEE, CONTRACTOR, VENDOR AND APPLICANT PRIVACY POLICY

Effective Date:

Effective Date: The earlier of 2024-08-29 or individual acknowledgment.

‍
Welcome to Grindr's Employee, Contractor, Vendor and Applicant Privacy Policy ("Policy"). All references in this policy to "Grindr", "we", "us", or "our", refer to Grindr LLC, its parent companies, and its subsidiaries such as Grindr Canada Inc. This Policy explains how Grindr processes Personal Information with respect to current and former employees, contractors, vendors and applicants ("In-Scope Individuals"). "Personal Information" means any information that allows someone to identify, or reasonably link to, you directly or indirectly. When we describe "processing" of Personal Information, we mean how we collect, use, share, and retain Personal Information.

By being transparent with how we collect and use your Personal Information, we hope you will be confident about the reasonable efforts Grindr is taking to safeguard your privacy.

California Residents. Please see Your California Privacy Rights to learn about the specific rights you are afforded under California privacy laws.

PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT

We start to collect Personal Information from In-Scope Individuals during the recruitment or onboarding process and throughout and post the duration of your employment or your engagement with Grindr. We may collect Personal Information directly from you, directly from the devices you use to support the work you do for Grindr, or from third-parties. We have to collect some Personal Information from you in order to pay you, reimburse you for expenses, provide you with benefits, and fulfill legal obligations (e.g., tax reporting). Sometimes providing Personal Information is optional (e.g., for optional company events).

Examples of Personal Information that Grindr collects about you include (without limitation):

  • Legal name or alias;
  • Date of birth;
  • Primary address;
  • Email address;
  • Government identifiers (e.g., social security number, driver's license number, passport);
  • Employment and education history;
  • Age, race, color, national origin, citizenship, religion or creed, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, sex (including gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy or childbirth and related medical conditions), sexual orientation (e.g., for same sex benefits), veteran or military status;
  • Browsing history, search history, information regarding your interaction with websites, applications, email/chat/social media platforms, or computer or access logs or other activity on any Grindr computer, Grindr network, or business information system;
  • Performance evaluations; and
  • Compensation information and tax withholding information.

SOURCES OF PERSONAL INFORMATION

We may collect Personal Information about you in various ways, including through:

  • Personal Information provided directly by you;
  • Payroll information including but not limited to social security or insurance number, tax details, and paycheck deposit information;
  • Wage and benefit information;
  • Beneficiary and emergency contact information;
  • Resumes and/or applications;
  • Degrees and diplomas;
  • References and interview notes;
  • Third party candidate sourcing technologies;
  • Photographs and video;
  • Government ID and related information such as driver's license, and passport;
  • Letters of offer and acceptance of employment;
  • Mandatory policy acknowledgement sign-off sheets;
  • Forms relating to the application for, or in respect of changes to, employee health and welfare benefits; including, short and long term disability, medical, vision, and dental care;
  • Family member data such as child's birth certificate, marriage certificate, or family member death certificate;
  • Background screening information;
  • Internal systems configurations may leverage your full name, title, role, etc. with your account details;
  • Grindr Services Setup (limited - see "Grindr Employee Use of Grindr Products and Services" below);
  • Your utilization of Grindr's information systems (such as SSO logs, IP address, device IDs, etc.);
  • Your utilization of Grindr’s business applications (such as business emails, Slack messages, etc.); and
  • Internal due diligence processes (e.g., when Grindr engages your organization to complete a vendor review).

WHAT WE DO WITH YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION

We gather the Personal Information listed above for business operations, including for establishing, maintaining, or terminating your employment or your engagement with Grindr. Such use cases include, but are not limited to:

  • Background reports and employment verification, including the verification of references;
  • Payroll and benefits processing;
  • Conducting performance reviews (including skills monitoring) and determining performance requirements;
  • Assessing qualifications for a particular job or task;
  • Parking and office access;
  • Complying with labor or employment law, including immigration filings;
  • Disability, unemployment, or other insurance claims;
  • Establishing training and/or development requirements;
  • Gathering evidence for disciplinary action, or termination;
  • Establishing a contact point in the event of an emergency;
  • Maintaining and sharing an organizational chart with roles and responsibilities;
  • Contributing to global initiatives such as diversity and inclusion, employee onboarding management, and global headcount management;
  • Ensuring the security of company-held information;
  • To comply with our legal obligations;
  • To identify and implement enhancements of our employee recruitment and retention practices;
  • To establish a point of contact for communication with third parties and for vendor payment purposes;
  • Other purposes as are reasonably required by Grindr in connection with your employment or engagement; and
  • For any additional purposes that we advise you of and for which we have a legal basis, which may for instance be your consent when such consent is required by law.

EMPLOYEE MONITORING

The work product of Grindr employees, whether in paper record, computer files, recorded communications, or in any other storage format, belongs to Grindr, and that work product, and the tools used to generate that work product, are always subject to review and monitoring by Grindr.

In the course of conducting our business, we may monitor employees' activities, online and within the workplace. For example, we have the capability to monitor all employees' use of workplace hardware, software and tools (e.g., laptop, email, and chat).

This section is not meant to suggest that all employees will in fact be monitored or their actions subject to constant surveillance. We have no duty to monitor. This is meant to bring to your attention that such monitoring may occur and may result in the collection of Personal Information from employees (e.g., through their use of company resources) and may be subject to use in accordance with this Privacy Policy. When using Grindr-specific equipment or Grindr resources (e.g., employer-provided network), employees should not have any expectation of privacy with respect to their use of such equipment or resources.

GRINDR EMPLOYEE USE OF GRINDR PRODUCTS AND SERVICES

Personal use of Grindr Services (as defined in the Grindr Privacy and Cookie Policy) by current employees and contractors is optional, although we welcome everyone to experience the app to better understand its function and features in the context of their employment with Grindr. Current employees or contractors may request upgrades to their personal Grindr accounts (e.g., Grindr Xtra or Grindr Unlimited). Personal Information required for an upgrade is the email address or account identifier associated with the Grindr account. Any normal course use of the Grindr Services by employees is governed by the Grindr Privacy and Cookie Policy.

HOW WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION

In some instances (i.e., on a conditional and need-to-know basis), Grindr may provide your Personal Information to employees, contractors, consultants, or service providers in order to fulfill our business needs or provide assistance or services to you directly (See “What We Do With Your Personal Information section”). Your Personal Information may also be provided under these specific circumstances:

  • As permitted or required by applicable law, rule, or regulatory requirements. In such a case, we will endeavor to not disclose more Personal Information than is required or appropriate under the circumstances;
  • To comply with valid legal processes, such as search warrants, subpoenas or court orders;
  • To protect the rights and property of Grindr;
  • During emergency situations or where necessary to protect the safety of a person or group of persons;
  • Where the Personal Information is publicly available (e.g., speaking at an event); or
  • With your consent where such consent is required by law.

Grindr does not sell In-Scope Individuals' Personal Information to third-parties.

HOW LONG WE KEEP YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION

Grindr retains your Personal Information for as long as is necessary to perform the business use cases listed in this Policy or to comply with federal, state, or local law.

YOUR CHOICES AND RIGHTS

In most cases, you have direct access to the systems Grindr uses to support the processing purposes above. Via such access, generally you'll be able to edit or delete your Personal Information yourself. Where your jurisdiction's law allows, you may also request access, edits, or deletions to your information that you're unable to access, delete or correct on your own by submitting a request through our website here.

Please note that requests for access, edits, or deletions are not always guaranteed, and may depend on the applicable laws. In the event we cannot fulfill your Personal Information request, Grindr will aim to provide a justification as to why.

PRIVACY OFFICE CONTACT

If you have questions regarding this Policy, you can submit a request through our website here.

YOUR CALIFORNIA PRIVACY RIGHTS

Below we provide specific information for California residents and describe the specific rights afforded to them in accordance with the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 ("CCPA") and the California Privacy Rights Act of 2020 ("CPRA").

Your Rights as a California Resident

  1. You can request the following information about how we have collected and used your Personal Information during the past 12 months (a majority of this information can be found in the table below or in the broader section of the Policy):

    1. The categories of Personal Information we have collected (see table below);

    2. The categories of sources from which we collected the Personal Information (see table below);

    3. The business or commercial purpose for collecting and/or selling Personal Information (see WHAT WE DO WITH YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION above. Per HOW WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION above, we do not sell In-Scope Individuals' Personal Information to third-parties for monetary or other valuable consideration (or share Personal Information for cross-contextual behavioral advertising purposes));

    4. The categories of third parties with whom we share the Personal Information (see table below);

    5. The categories of Personal Information that we sold or shared for cross-contextual behavioral advertising or disclosed for a business purpose (e.g., Service Providers and Other Partners) (see table below);

    6. The categories of third parties to whom the Personal Information was sold or shared for cross-contextual behavioral advertising, or disclosed for a business purpose (see table below);

  2. You can request a copy of the Personal Information that we have collected about you during the past 12 months. You can make these requests twice a year and Grindr has up to 45 days to respond to your request (with an optional additional 45 days that Grindr may inform you about);
  3. You can ask us to delete the Personal Information that we have collected from you;
  4. You can correct inaccurate Personal Information;
  5. Grindr does not sell In-Scope Individuals' Personal Information to third parties for monetary or other valuable consideration (or share Personal Information for cross-contextual behavioral advertising purposes).
  6. You are entitled to exercise the rights described above free from discrimination.

Authorized Agents. If you are an authorized agent for a California individual, please click here to submit a request and attach a signed designation form from the individual that you represent authorizing you to serve as the individual's agent for the purposes of exercising the individual's rights under the applicable California law. Individuals can optionally notarize the document or provide a Power of Attorney document along with the signed designation form. If you do NOT provide the signed designation form, we cannot honor any requests you submit on behalf of the individual.

Data Retention. We retain your Personal Information for no longer than is necessary to fulfill the purposes for which the information was collected or as otherwise permitted or required by applicable law or pursuant to Grindr Terms and Conditions of Service and/or Grindr Community Guidelines Community Guidelines (the latter applicable to the In-Scope Individual's use of the Grindr Services).

For In-Scope Individuals who use the Grindr Services, you can visit our Privacy Help Center to learn more about our features that support your privacy and choices. To exercise your choice and rights, click here. Statistics pertaining to Grindr's processing of access, deletion and correction requests (which includes statistics with respect to In-Scope Individuals' use of the Grindr Services) can be found here.

If you would like to request a copy of information regarding our disclosure to third parties for their direct marketing purposes in the preceding calendar year, or if you have questions about your California privacy rights, you can submit a request through our website here or by postal mail at: Grindr LLC, Attn: Privacy Office, PO Box 69176, West Hollywood, CA 90069.

4. 사용자가 특정 서비스
및 자산 기능을 즐길 수 있
도록 허용합니다
5. 제3자 광고/마케팅 파
트너가 문맥 광고
(Contextual serving
ads)를 제공하기 위한 목
적으로 Grindr 서비스에
서 쿠키 및 기타 기술을 사
용할 수 있도록 허용
6. 법적 의무 준수를 위하
여 법 집행 기관, 규제기
관 및 기타 제3자의 법적
요청에 대응
 회원 탈퇴 시까지. 회사는 내부 보고
및 평가지표(metrics), 보안, 사기
방지 및 스팸 방지 활동 등 제한된
목적을 지원하기 위하여 일부 제한
된 개인정보를 최대 2년간 보유 및
이용할 수 있습니다. 다만, 관계 법
령의 규정에 따라 필요한 경우에는
해당 법령에서 정한 기간 동안 개인
정보를 보유할 수 있습니다.
선
택
 귀하 및 귀하에 대한 하드웨어 및 소프트웨어 정보, 이
용자 활동, 쿠키, 로그 파일, 픽셀 태그, 프로필 정보 항
목(표시 이름(Display Name), 자기 소개(About
Me), 표시 나이(Display Age), 관계 상태
(Relationship Status), 체형(Body Type), 키
(Height), 몸무게(Weight), 소셜미디어상 사용자명
(Social Media handles), 찾는 대상(Looking For),
만날 장소(Meet At), NSFW 사진 수락), 채팅 메시지
내용(문자, 음성, 영상, 사진), 앨범 콘텐츠, 위치 공유
정보, 기기 지리적 위치
 1. 귀하의 Grindr 계정과
관련된 서비스를 귀하에
게 제공
2. 귀하의 문의에 대한 답
변 및 지원 제공
3. 서비스 내에서 당사의
자산을 개선하고 안전을
보장합니다
4. Grindr의 회사로서의
이익 보호
5. 사용자가 특정 서비스
및 자산 기능을 즐길 수 있
도록 허용합니다
6. 제3자 광고/마케팅 파
트너가 개인 맞춤형 광고
를 제공하기 위한 목적으
로 Grindr 서비스에서 쿠
키 및 기타 기술을 사용할
수 있도록 허용
7. 법적 의무 준수를 위하
여 법 집행 기관, 규제기
관 및 기타 제3자의 법적
요청에 대응
 상동


회사는 다음과 같이 한국 내 이용자의 민감정보를 처리합니다.

구

선

백신 접종(Vaccine Status))
 1. 귀하의 Grindr 계
정과 관련된 서비스를

2. 서비스 내에서 당

3. 사용자가 특정 서

 회원 탈퇴 시까지. 다만, 관계 법

제2조 (개인정보의 제3자 제공)


회사는 원칙적으로 정보주체의 개인정보를 제1조에서 명시한 목적 범위 내에서 처리하며, 정보주체의 동의, 법률의 특별한 규정 등 개인정보 보호법 제17조, 제18조 및 제28조의8에 해당하는 경우에만 개인정보를 제3자에게 제공하고 그 이외에는 정보주체의 개인정보를 제3자에게 제공하지 않습니다.


회사는 다음의 경우 정보주체의 동의를 얻어 필요 최소한의 범위로만 제공합니다.

귀하는 위에서 설명한 개인정보의 국외 이전을 거부할 권리가 있습니다. 개인정보의 국외 이전을 거부하려면
privacy@grindr.com 또는 support@grindr.com. 로 연락하여 요청을 전달해 주시기 바랍니다. 단, 이러한 거부의 결과로 인
해 회사는 귀하에게 더 이상 서비스를 제공하지 못할 수 있다는 점에 유의하시기 바랍니다.


회사는 개인정보 처리업무 위탁 시 개인정보 보호법 제26조에 따라 위탁업무 수행목적 외 개인정보 처리금지, 기술적관리적 보
호조치, 재위탁 제한, 수탁자에 대한 관리 감독, 손해배상 등 책임에 관한 사항을 문서에 명시하고, 수탁자가 개인정보를 안전하게
처리하는지 감독하고 있습니다.


위탁업무의 내용이나 수탁자가 변경될 경우에는 지체없이 본 개인정보 처리방침을 통하여 공개하도록 하겠습니다


제4조 (정보주체의 권리·의무 및 그 행사방법)


정보주체는 개인정보 보호법 등 관계법령이 정하는 바에 따라 회사에 대해 개인정보의 열람, 정정 및 삭제, 처리정지 요구 등 개인
정보 관련 권리를 행사할 수 있습니다.


제1항에 따른 권리행사는 정보주체의 법정대리인이나 위임을 받은 사람을 통해서도 할 수 있습니다.


회사는 정보주체의 권리행사에 대하여 개인정보보호법 등 관계법령이 정하는 바에 따라 지체 없이 조치하겠습니다.


제5조 (개인정보의 파기 절차 및 방법)


회사는 기타 법령에 따라 개인정보를 보존하여야 하는 경우를 제외하고 개인정보 보유기간이 만료되거나 처리목적이 달성된 후 지
체없이 해당 개인정보를 파기합니다.


개인정보 파기의 절차 및 방법은 다음과 같습니다.


파기절차


회사는 파기 사유가 발생한 개인정보를 선별하고, 개인정보 보호책임자의 승인을 받아 해당 개인정보를 파기합니다.


파기방법


회사는 전자적 파일 형태로 기록·저장된 개인정보는 기록을 재생할 수 없도록 로우 레벨 포맷팅(low-level formatting) 또는 이와
유사한 방법으로 파기하며, 종이 문서에 기록·보존된 개인정보는 분쇄기로 분쇄하여 파기합니다.


제6조 (개인정보의 안전성 확보 조치)
회사는 개인정보보호법 제29조에 따라 다음 각 호와 같이 안전성 확보에 필요한 기술적/관리적 및 물리적 조치를 하고 있습니다.


관리적 조치: 내부관리계획 수립·시행, 전담조직 운영, 정기적 직원 교육


기술적 조치: 개인정보처리시스템 등의 접근권한 관리, 접근통제시스템 설치, 개인정보의 암호화, 보안프로그램 설치 및 갱신


물리적 조치: 전산실, 자료보관실 등의 접근통제


제7조 (쿠키)


회사는 회사의 특정 웹사이트에서 세션 쿠키, 지속 쿠키(persistent cookies)를 포함하나 이에 한정되지 않는 쿠키 및 웹 비콘을
사용할 수 있습니다. 쿠키란 이용자가 해당 웹사이트를 방문한 이력을 컴퓨터에서 저장하여 회사에 알려주는 파일입니다.


이용자가 해당 웹사이트에 접속하면 회사는 접속 빈도, 방문 시간 등의 분석, 이용자 추적, 이벤트 참여 및 방문 빈도 등의 정보 파악
을 통한 업무상 통계 목적으로 쿠키를 사용할 수 있습니다.


이용자는 쿠키 설치에 대한 선택권을 가지고 있습니다. 이용자는 자신의 컴퓨터의 웹 브라우저에서 관련 기능을 조정하여 모든 쿠
키를 허용하거나, 쿠키가 설치될 때 통지를 보내도록 하거나, 모든 쿠키의 허용을 거부할 수 있습니다.


설치방법 예시(인터넷 익스플로러의 경우): 웹 브라우저 상단의 도구 버튼 > 인터넷 옵션 > 개인정보


회사의 쿠키 정책에 대한 자세한 정보는 ( 링크)에서 확인하실 수 있습니다.


제8조 (권리침해 구제)


이용자는 개인정보 침해로 인한 구제를 받기 위하여 개인정보 분쟁조정위원회, 한국인터넷진흥원 등에 분쟁조정, 상담 등을 신청할
수 있습니다.


그 밖의 개인정보 침해의 신고 및 상담은 개인정보 분쟁조정위원회, 대검찰청 사이버수사과, 경찰청 사이버테러대응센터로 문의하
시기 바랍니다.


제9조 (개인정보 보호책임자)


회사는 개인정보를 보호하고 개인정보와 관련한 불만을 처리하기 위하여 아래와 같이 개인정보보호법 제31조 제1항에 따른 개인
정보 보호책임자를 지정하고 있습니다.


직책: 개인정보 보호책임자


성명: Kelly Peterson Miranda


연락처: privacy@grindr.com 또는 support@grindr.com (전술한 이메일 주소로 전송되는 메시지는 개인정보 보호를 담당하
는 고객 지원 부서로 전달됩니다.)


회사의 개인정보 열람청구를 접수·처리하는 부서는 다음과 같습니다.


부서: 고객 지원


연락처: privacy@grindr.com 또는 support@grindr.com (전술한 이메일 주소로 전송되는 메시지는 개인정보 보호를 담당하
는 고객 지원 부서로 전달됩니다.)


정보주체는 회사의 서비스를 이용하시면서 발생한 모든 개인정보보호 관련 문의, 불만처리, 피해구제 등에 관한 사항을 개인정보
보호책임자 및 담당부서로 문의할 수 있습니다.


제10조 (본 개인정보 처리방침의 변경)


본 개인정보 처리방침은 2023년 12월 19일부터 적용됩니다.


개인정보 처리방침의 이전 버전은 아래를 참조하시기 바랍니다.


2023년 3월 15일부터 2023년 6월 20일까지 적용(링크)


2023년 6월 21일부터 2023년 12월 18일까지의 적용(링크)


제정일자 2023. 12. 19.

GRINDR CONSUMER HEALTH DATA PRIVACY POLICIES

GRINDR CONSUMER HEALTH DATA PRIVACY POLICIES

Effective Date: Sep 1, 2025

Effective Date: The earlier of 2025-September -01 or user acknowledgment.

Washington Consumer Health Data Privacy Policy


Welcome to Grindr’s Washington Consumer Health Data Privacy Policy (“Washington Policy”) pursuant to the Washington My Health My Data Act (the “MHMD Act”). All references in this Washington Policy to “Grindr”, “we”, “us”, or “our”, refer to Grindr LLC, its parent companies, and its subsidiaries such as Grindr Canada Inc. This Washington Policy explains how Grindr Processes the Consumer Health Data (as defined by MHMD Act) of Washington residents and individuals whose Consumer Health Data is Collected in Washington (collectively, “Consumers”). This Washington Policy covers these activities across all of our properties (“Properties” or “Grindr Properties”), as defined in the Grindr Privacy and Cookie Policy.


This Washington Policy supplements the disclosures in our Grindr Privacy and Cookie Policy to provide specific disclosures required under the MHMD Act. In the event of a conflict between any other policy, statement, or notice and this Washington Policy, this Washington Policy will prevail as to Consumer Health Data Collected under the MHMD Act.


Capitalized terms that are not otherwise defined in this Washington Policy shall be defined as they are in the MHMD Act.


I. Consumer Health Data Collection, Use, and Purpose


“Consumer Health Data” means personal information that is linked or reasonably linkable to a Consumer and that identifies the Consumer’s past, present, or future physical or mental health status.

Per the MHMD Act, we collect the following Consumer Health Data from Consumers as set out below for the specified purposes.

Consumer Health Data Categories

Consumer Health Data Sources

Consumer Health Data Uses and Purposes

Self-Reported Health-Related Profile Fields, such as HIV status, Last Tested Date, and poz (should you choose to include this optional information)

From you when you choose to enter information into the Grindr Properties
  • Allow Consumers to disclose health information to other users who are part of the Grindr Community in order to facilitate user connections
  • Provide testing reminders
  • Respond to specific customer requests and inquiries, including customer support

Vaccination Information, including vaccination status

From you when you choose to enter information into the Grindr Properties
  • Allow Consumers to disclose health information to other users who are part of the Grindr Community in order to facilitate user connections
  • Respond to specific customer requests and inquiries, including customer support

Record of Consumer Accessing Healthcare Resources, such as Grindr for Equality public service announcements

Collected automatically through cookies and online tracking technologies

We use these records to connect you with products or services you requested, including to:

  • Monitor the effectiveness of the public service announcements on an aggregate level

Precise Location Information that could reasonably indicate a Consumer’s attempt to acquire or receive Health Services or Supplies if you are using location-based services while at a location that provides health services or supplies

Collected automatically when you have enabled precise geolocation sharing and are actively using the Grindr Application

Grindr does not use Precise Location Information to determine whether a Consumer is attempting to acquire or receive health services or supplies. We use Precise Location Information to provide products or services you requested, including to:

  • Display your distance to other users within the Grindr community based on approximate distance
  • Allow Consumers to share location with others who are part of the Grindr Community and discover other users’ location
  • Respond to specific customer requests and inquiries, including customer support
  • Troubleshoot and improve the product or service

Photographs (such as Profile or Album pictures) that may contain images of a Consumer from which a biometric identifier template could be extracted

From you when you choose to enter information into the Grindr Properties

Grindr does not create biometric identifier templates from photographs. We use images you provide to provide products or services you requested, including to:

  • Allow Consumers to Share photographs with other users who are part of the Grindr Community in order to facilitate user connections
  • Allow users to search profiles containing pictures
  • Respond to specific customer requests and inquiries, including customer support
  • Troubleshoot and improve the product or service

Audio and Video Recordings that contain recordings of a Consumer from which a biometric identifier template could be extracted

From you when you choose to enter information into the Grindr Properties

Grindr does not create biometric identifier templates from recordings. We use audio and video recordings to provide products or services requested, including to:

  • Allow Consumers to share recordings with other users who are part of the Grindr Community in order to facilitate user connections
  • Respond to specific customer requests and inquiries, including customer support
  • Troubleshoot and improve the product or service

Health Information, including the categories described above or any other health information that a consumer decides to self-disclose

When you provide information in response to a user research study

Improve the Grindr Properties and communicate with you in response to your feedback

We may use any of the above categories of Consumer Health Data to prevent, detect, protect against, and respond to security incidents, identity theft, fraud, harassment, malicious or deceptive activities, or any activity that is illegal under Washington state or federal law; preserve the integrity and security of our systems; investigate, report, or prosecute those responsible for any illegal action under Washington state or federal law; and as otherwise permitted or required by law.

II. Sharing Consumer Health Data

We may Share Consumer Health Data with third parties where we obtain consent from the Consumer for another purpose.


We Share Consumer Health Data among our Affiliates to carry out our operations and provide services to Consumers. These Affiliates include: Grindr Canada Inc.


We may Share any of the above categories of Consumer Health Data to prevent, detect, protect against, and respond to security incidents, identity theft, fraud, harassment, malicious or deceptive activities, or any activity that is illegal under Washington state or federal law; preserve the integrity and security of our systems; investigate, report, or prosecute those responsible for any illegal action under Washington state or federal law; and as otherwise permitted or required by law.


We do not Sell Consumer Health Data. In the event this changes, we will not Sell Consumer Health Data without first obtaining valid authorization from the applicable Consumer.


III. Consumer Health Data Rights

Consumers have the right to submit certain requests relating to your Consumer Health Data as described below.

The easiest way to exercise your rights while protecting your privacy and security is by logging into your account so we can verify your account ownership. You can also make a request outside of your Grindr account by clicking here, but then we’ll require some additional information to authenticate your identity and ownership of your account.


Consumers have the right to:

  • Confirm whether we are Collecting, Sharing, or Selling your Consumer Health Data;

  • Access your Consumer Health Data;

  • Request that your Consumer Health Data be deleted; 

  • Withdraw Consent from our Collection and Sharing of your Consumer Health Data; and

  • Obtain a list of all Third Parties and Affiliates with whom we have Shared your Consumer Health Data and an active email address or other online mechanism to contact these parties.


If you choose to exercise any of your privacy rights, we will not discriminate against you.


You may be able to appeal a decision made regarding your privacy request by submitting a request here. In the event we deny your appeal, we will provide a written explanation of the decision, and instructions on how to contact your local Attorney General for further review.

Nevada Consumer Health Data Privacy Policy

This Nevada Consumer Health Data Privacy Policy (“Nevada Health Data Policy”) explains how Grindr Processes the Consumer Health Data of Nevada residents and individuals whose Consumer Health Data is Collected in Nevada (“Nevada Consumers”) pursuant to the Nevada Consumer Health Data law (“Nevada Law”). This Nevada Health Data Policy covers these activities across our Grindr Properties. Capitalized terms that are not otherwise defined in this Nevada Health Data Policy shall be defined as they are in the Nevada Law.


In the event of a conflict between any other policy, statement, or notice and this Nevada Health Data Policy, this Nevada Health Data Policy will prevail as to Consumer Health Data Collected from or about Nevada Consumers.


For the purposes of this section, “Nevada Consumer Health Data” means personally identifiable information that is linked or reasonably capable of being linked to a Nevada Consumer and that a Regulated Entity uses to identify the past, present or future health status of the Nevada Consumer. We collect the following Nevada Consumer Health Data from Nevada Consumers for the specified purposes.



Nevada Consumer Health Data Categories

Nevada Consumer Health Data Sources

Nevada Consumer Health Data Uses and Purposes

A. Self-Reported Health-Related Profile Fields, such as HIV status, Last Tested Date, and poz (should you choose to include this optional information)

From you when you choose to enter information into the Grindr Properties

1. Allow Consumers to disclose health information to other users who are part of the Grindr Community in order to facilitate user connections

2. Provide testing reminders

3. Respond to specific customer requests and inquiries, including customer support

B. Vaccination Information, including vaccination status

From you when you enter information into the Grindr Properties

1. Allow Consumers to disclose health information to other users who are part of the Grindr Community in order to facilitate user connections

2. Respond to specific customer requests and inquiries, including customer support

C. Health Information, including the categories described above or any other health information that a consumer decides to self-disclose

When you provide information in response to a user research study

Improve the Grindr Properties and communicate with you in response to your feedback

We may use and Share any Nevada Consumer Health Data we collect in order to comply with law enforcement activities or as expressly authorized by federal or state law, including to comply with valid legal process.


We may Share Consumer Health Data with third parties where we obtain consent from the Consumer for another purpose or where permitted or authorized by another provision of law. We Share Consumer Health Data among our Affiliates to carry out our operations and provide services to Consumers. 


We do not Sell Consumer Health Data. In the event this changes, we will not Sell Consumer Health Data without first obtaining valid authorization from the applicable Consumer.


Third Parties do not Collect Nevada Consumer Health Data over time and across different Internet websites or online services when a Consumer uses the Grindr Properties.


Nevada Consumers have the right to submit certain requests relating to your Consumer Health Data, specifically Nevada Consumers have the right to:

  • Confirm whether we are Collecting, Sharing, or Selling your Consumer Health Data;

  • Request that we cease Collecting and/or Sharing your Consumer Health Data; 

  • Request that your Consumer Health Data be deleted; and

  • Receive a list of all Third Parties with whom we have Shared your Consumer Health Data.


Nevada Consumers that have been denied one of the above enumerated rights have the right to request an appeal. If you choose to exercise any of your privacy rights, we will not discriminate against you.
